direction.raw_text: top of mansion steps as Groucho comes from mansion... the two guards standing stiffly erect, form a seat by crossing hands... Groucho sits on the seat made by their hands, puts his arms around their shoulders and they carry him down stairs... as fast as they can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harpo arriving in front of mansion just as Groucho, carried by the men, moves into the scene.  Groucho gets into the side-car... and in Napoleonic manner says to Harpo:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harpo takes a phonograph record and smashes it on the ground... there is a roar of the motor -- the motorcycle starts off but leaves the side-car. Groucho gets out of side-car... starts back to steps, stops and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he dashes up the stairs, we CUT TO Harpo... riding along... A very attractive girl is coming along in the opposite direction.  As she approaches Harpo, he toots his horn to attract her attention, she throws him a indignant look and continues on down the street.  Harpo turns his motorcycle around and starts after her.  She looks around, sees Harpo pursuing and breaks into a run... CUT BACK to Harpo following her, putting on speed... he lowers the Freedonian flag and simultaneously raises a pirate flag -- with skull and cross- bones on it, displayed prominently.  A motorcycle cop is parked on the corner waiting for prospective violators... he sees Harpo chasing the girl and quickly starts his motor and follows in pursuit... The girl, as she reaches the executive mansion, rushes up the stairs in an effort to escape.  Harpo comes into the scene and rides up the stairs after her... As Harpo gets about half way up the stairs the motorcycle cop is seen approaching the mansion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: To the House of Representatives... ride like fury... Don't stop for any signals and don't wait for a corner to make a turn... see if you can break a record...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A fine thing -- leaving the head of the nation at the foot of the stairs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reception room of mansion as the girl is running madly through the room... a moment later we see Harpo on his bike following... there is panic among the guests.  Then we see the girl tearing up the stairs leading to the circular balcony...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to Harpo.  He looks behind him as he rides and sees the motorcycle cop following on his bike.  On the balcony above,  the girl is running, with an occasional glance over her shoulder as she runs out of scene... Harpo rides into scene.  This time he is bent over his handle-bars in the manner of a six day bicycle rider... following closely behind him rides the motorcycle cop.  They circle the mezzanine... Harpo in the lead, looking back now and then over his shoulder at his pursuer... this is done in imitation of a six day bicycle race... The motorcycle cop is closing in on Harpo... the latter approaching a large open door, rides through the opening, but the cop continues on around the balcony...  as he gets to the opposite side of the circular balcony he passes another open doorway.  Harpo comes riding out of it and is now in pursuit of the cop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: down stairs to Groucho... One hand is upraised holding a gun.  As he looks at a wrist watch, he fires gun, then addresses guests looking into CAMERA.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That concludes the nine o'clock sprints... Next Saturday night the winner of the six day bicycle race will receive ten thousand dollars in gold... the following morning we go off the gold standard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to balcony... Harpo is passing the cop...  He holds up his hand for the cop to stop... they both come to a halt... Harpo gets off his motorcycle, walks over angrily to cop, takes out his book, writes out a summons and hands it to the cop as we FADE OUT...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on interior of Freedonian House of Representatives. This interior although not a replica of our own House of Representatives, should be close enough technically to sell the idea... Each seat is occupied by an officious-looking dignitary.  On the platform are a few desks... perhaps a pulpit which Groucho uses when he arrives...  The one to the right is the court stenographer's desk, occupied by Bob Firefly.  He takes notes as the meeting progresses. Throughout the House runs a ripple of excitement, which is stopped by the rapping of the gavel by the Speaker of the House.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trentino takes the floor
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob rises to interrupt
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob presses a button, either on desk or wall...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: END OF SEQUENCE "A" SEQUENCE "B" FADE IN

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, gentlemen, remember for forty-six years we have enjoyed the friendship of Amnesia, so ably represented by Ambassador Trentino. (Indicating the Ambassador who is present) We owe it to ourselves to listen to what he has to say...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, while I admit it is unusual for a representative of one country to advise the legislative body of another, I assure you that I have the interest of Freedonia at heart ... (Deferential applause) We have lent you money in the past -- we are willing to lend you money again -- but, we cannot do it if your leader is allowed by you, to carry out his ridiculous proposals... In self-protection it is my --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I object!...  we have no right to discuss this matter in the absence of my father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To House) We have been meeting every morning for eight days and not once has His Excellency been on time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Looking at his watch) Gentlemen, I cannot wait much longer...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Bob) Would you mind calling your father again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - the corner of Groucho's bedroom, showing fireman's pole.  The sound of the clanging bell is heard over scene. Groucho hurries into scene, fully clad but for his coat which he has on his arm... without waiting to don his coat he slides down the pole.  We pick him up finishing the slide down the pole into the House of Representatives.  As he arrives the members are on their feet singing the last four bars of the national anthem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho hurries toward Speaker's desk, putting on his coat as he goes...  Just as he reaches the desk the singing subsides.  Groucho turns to the body of men and looks off in the direction of one of the representatives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off scene we hear Chico's voice singing "P-E-A-N-U-T-S"... this is followed by the piping of a whistle playing the first strain of the PEANUT VENDOR... Groucho listens, annoyed and then continues
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again Chico's voice comes over scene singing "P-E-A-N-U-T- S"...  The whistling of the first strain of song - the PEANUT VENDOR is heard again
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trentino exits resentfully
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Singing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Land of the brave and free...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Pointing toward the individual off scene) The Secretary of Agriculture was a little flat... (He takes a match and scratches it across the top of the desk to light his cigar... takes a few puffs, then raps the gavel.) I move we open the morning session... Has anybody got a cork screw? (Looking out and around at members) [page missing]
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's to stop you from digging one... And after you dig a river, how're ya gonna cross it without a bridge...? We've got to have a bridge to stop people from going places -- then we've gotta stop them from coming back.  If you're worried about the expense we can have a bridge with only one end -- and if that's a success we can do away with it altogether. I'm telling you that what this country needs is --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If there's one thing we don't need right now -- it's peanuts -- gentlemen, what good is a bridge if you haven't got ammunition to blow it up... ammunition was never cheaper...  Right now, you can get two cannons for the price of one and shoot twice as far for half the money...  With every five thousand dollar purchase we throw in a Big Bertha... If you don't like her, you can throw her right out again.  I tell you no country can protect itself without --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry your Excellency, it is that infernal peanut vendor Chicolini... How can we accomplish anything with that constant annoyance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your Excellency - are we or are we not going to discuss this problem - my time is valuable - I'm a man of few words -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a man of one word... SCRAM!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Bob - aroused) Go out and chase that peanut vendor away from the building -- Get rid of him if you have to use violence - if necessary call out the militia and if he isn't looking get me a bag of peanuts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've tried to chase him but it's no use - he won't go -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He won't eh? - We'll see about that - send for your father immediately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you're my father -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind then, I'll get in touch with him myself -
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to Chico standing by his peanut stand which has a whistle on it conspicuously displayed -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP of whistle piping tune of "PEANUT VENDOR" - Trentino enters to Chico -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Singing even louder than before - Trentino smirks approvingly and exits - the whistling of the tune following as we CUT inside to Groucho - and the well-known vamp of the "Peanut Vendor" is heard coming over scene with orchestra accompaniment...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks determinedly in direction of window and breaks into a rhumba - with hands on hips - dipping to ground a la Spanish dancer... as he reaches window we CUT outside.  Groucho is seen in the window - which is on the ground floor - Chico is by his peanut stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chico takes bag of peanuts from stand - throws it to Groucho - The latter catches bag and throws Chico a dime - then starts to eat the peanuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho turns and disappears from the window - CUT INSIDE of House of Representatives
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho exits towards door leading into his private office. CUT to inside of private office which has another door leading to a hallway, and among other articles of furniture, there is an impressive-looking desk on which is a telephone.  Just as Groucho comes through the door into his office, Chico enters through the other door.  He is wearing gauntlets, reaching half way up his arms.  As they walk toward each other the telephone rings and the two men make a mad  dash for the telephone on the desk.  Chico beats Groucho to the phone, picks up the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chico hangs up receiver and turns to Groucho who is waiting impatiently
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Telephone bell rings.  The two men turn and run for the telephone.  Again Chico gets there first.  Groucho stands by exasperated while Chico talks to the party on the other end of the line
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Telephone bell rings.  They both make a dash for the telephone, but Harpo rushes in through hallway door and reaches the phone first.  Harpo picks up through telephone receiver, listens to conversation on the other end with an occasional nod and shake of the head.  As he listens, he scribbles message on a piece of paper.  He holds the written message up to the telephone receiver for a moment, then writes a few more words on the paper.  During this, Chico and Groucho stand by, terribly worried.  Finally Harpo hangs up the receiver and exits, tearing up the paper
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho suddenly slaps Chico across the face with his gloves, then as quickly brings to light a card which he presents to Chico in the professional manner of an experienced duelist
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chico whispers in Groucho's ear -- Groucho gives him an indignant look
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chico turns to go - Groucho stops him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At this point Chico is at the door and exits - Groucho slams the door right in his face - then he walks over to the desk and sees the larger gauntlets.  He takes a swing with his own gloves, then takes a hefty swing with the gauntlet.  He leaves his own gloves on the desk and exits with the gauntlets in is hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Singing loudly)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Trentino) How'm I doing, boss?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine - keep on yelling - Do everything you can to disturb Firefly - Now what about your cousin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's working very hard - I got him a job driving Firefly's car - He's-a driving him crazy and I'm driving him nuts - P-E-A-N-U-T-S
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Glaring angrily at window) I'll get rid of that pest - watch me --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Chico - angrily) Hey you!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you got a license?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, but my dog he's a got millions of them -- GROUCHO (Munching peanuts as Chico walks over and stands under window) What kind of a dog is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He used to be a bloodhound but he's anemic -- GROUCHO Well - what is he now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's half poodle and half watch dog -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Half watch dog?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh, he's only got one eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know much about dogs but you ought to be on the end of a leash - a ninety-nine year leash - (Gives him a look of disgust) Look - what do you call your dog?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't call him, I whistle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you whistle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yankee Poodle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got just the place for a man like you but I'm too busy right now to do any digging.  What do you call your dog when you want him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, if you don't want your dog why don't you put him in a pound?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He only weighs ten ounces -- GROUCHO I can use you in the House of Representatives.  We need a man who understands dogs -- and that's where this country is going to.  Step inside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Bob) In case of fire, how long will it take to empty this place?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (After a moment's thought) About - thirty-four seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll start a fire -- (Indicating representatives)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: and get rid of these microbes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (At telephone) Hello!...  Yes...  Yes...  He's not in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry I'm not in.  I wanted to have a long talk with you...  Now look here, my good man, you've got to stop yelling "peanuts" in front of the House of Representatives.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no, I can't do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't want to be a public nuisance, do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.  How much does the job pay? (or) Sure, if there's a chance for advancement.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wouldn't consider going over Niagara Falls without a barrel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'At's-a no good.  I went to Niagara Falls once.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you shoot the rapids?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, but I shot some ducks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If there was an open season for fellows like you, I'd get myself a hunting license.   Anyway, I'm going to make you a sporting proposition. You give up the peanut stand and I'll make you vice-president of the country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no -- nothing doing.  I had a brother who was a vice-president once and that's the last we ever heard of him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, maybe he's still the vice- president.  Now if I were to offer you --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To telephone) Hello...  Yes...  No, not yet... All right...  Goodbye. (Hangs up receiver - then says to Groucho) That was for you again.  He wants you to call him up as soon as you get back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what's keeping me.  I should've been here a long time ago. Now how about my proposition?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What other job you got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's see -- What've I got in my cabinet besides mice -- (Stops to think - then very enthusiastically) I've got it -- how would you like to be Secretary of the Interior?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's no good.  I like to work on the outside.  I must have something easy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you don't wanna work hard?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't wanna work at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In that case you'll have to take a civil service examination --  if you pass I'll put you in the post-office -- stick out your tongue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't wanna stick out my tongue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, if you wanna work in the post- office you'll have to stick out your tongue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I'm a very nervous man.  I gotta have a job where I come to work at eleven -- go to lunch at twelve -- and quit at one.  And twice a year I gotta have a six month vacation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got just the job for you -- Secretary of War.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'At's-a fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (After a moment's glance at Harpo) You know, I'd be lost without a telephone.  Now - where were we? Oh, yes - I just made you Secretary of War.  The first thing you do is buy ammunition -- you buy it from me and I get 10% commission.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do I get?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You get half mine and I get half yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to buy ammunition -- we no gotta war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we've gotta start one. Do you know how to start a war?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, that's easy.  You gotta insult somebody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My card.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Laughing) That's a-no good.  You gotta insult somebody from another country.  Look -- (Puts his large gloves on the desk) I come from one country.  You come from another country.  I say something you don't like.  You say something I don't like - and I'm insulted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why wasn't I insulted?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You was insulted, but you don't know it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Indignantly) Then I demand an apology!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's a-no good.  If I apologize we no got a war.  Look -- I send you a scrap of paper.  You send me a scrap of paper -- and we have a scrap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got a brain after all - and how you get along without it is amazing to me -- Now, who can I insult?...  Who do we owe money to?... (Enthusiastically)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !  How about him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's-a very easy to insult --  I say something to his niece once, and he slapped my face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't his niece slap your face?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you say to her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're lucky I don't slap your face -- you oughtta be ashamed of yourself. Where did you hear that story?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You told it to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Puzzled for a moment) Oh, yes, I remember -- and I should have slapped Mrs. Teasdale's face when she told it to me... I'm going right out and find Trentino.  You go right out and get yourself an army.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute.  What kind of an army do you think we oughtta have?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think we oughtta have a standing army, so we can save money on chairs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: outside.  Harpo is just pulling up to the curb in front of the House of Representatives, in his motorcycle and side car.  Groucho comes from the building wearing gauntlets, gets into the side car and with a dignified wave of his hand, says:

direction.raw_text: And, as he gets out of the side car and starts to go back into the building, the scene
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to garden party.  This is an afternoon tea in the garden of the Teasdale estate.   Spotted in the set-up are innumerable colorful umbrellas, under which are tea tables. The guests include the notables we saw in the mansion in the first sequence.  The only two people absent are Ambassador Trentino and Mrs. Teasdale.  Vera Trentino is seated at one of the tables and her presence is established there in the opening shot.  Music is heard over the scene and should be continued through the scene as if being played by an orchestra on the premises.  Suddenly the chatter ceases as the following announcement is heard coming over scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All eyes turn toward those off scene and everyone rises to sing the last four bars of the national anthem. Cut to the gateway leading into the garden... a servant on each side of the gate, as Groucho jauntily strides through the gate, swinging the unusually large gauntlets...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho hands his high silk hat to one of the guards and starts down the walk among the guests.  From his attitude it is evident that he is intent on finding Ambassador Trentino. Suddenly he stops, having seen something of interest off scene.  The following dialogue comes over the scene.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: To Mrs. Teasdale's residence!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the fifth trip I've made today and I haven't been anywhere yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Land of the brave and free...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't you see, Gloria, our marriage would not only unite two great families...

direction.raw_text: Trentino and Mrs. Teasdale in a quiet corner of the garden -- both are at a tea table.  This shot leaves Groucho out.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sudden ripple of excitement as the guests, attracted by the rumpus begin to move into the scene.  Prominent among these is Vera Trentino.  Trentino refuses Groucho's card, white with rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns on his heel as if about to leave.  Groucho stops him

dialogue.raw_text: (Continuing) ...but would further cement the relations of our countries.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TEASDALE (Fluttering with excitement) Ambassador Trentino, I am indeed honored... (Falteringly) But you see - well - I -- TRENTINO (Repressing his anger - coldly) Oh.  Then there his somebody else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TEASDALE Well no -- not exactly -- but -- TRENTINO (Impatiently) Gloria -- I've waited for years.  I won't be put off!  I love you!  I want you! (Taking her hand pleadingly) Can't you see that I'm at your feet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Trentino) When you get through with her feet, you can start on mine.  I haven't been to a chiropodist in two years... (To CAMERA) If that's not an insult, I don't know what is. (Turns to Gloria) Gloria, I love you.  I -- TRENTINO (Furious, to Gloria) Can't we go some place where we can be alone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Mrs. Teasdale) What can this mug offer you?  Wealth and family.  I can't give you wealth... (Archly lifting his eyebrow) ...but we can have a little family of our own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TEASDALE (Coyly) Oh, Rufus!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All I can offer you is a Rufus over your head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TEASDALE (Happily confused) Oh, Your Excellency, I don't know what to say.

dialogue.raw_text: I wouldn't know what to say either if I was in your place. (Turning to Trentino) Maybe you can suggest something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Hotly) This has gone far enough!  This interruption is humiliating, to say the least...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, why not say the least and get it over with?

dialogue.raw_text: . TEASDALE (Fearful) Gentlemen!  Gentlemen!

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what you think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Furiously) You swine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me that again!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You worm!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Once more! (Holds his gauntlets in his hand, ready at any moment to strike)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You upstart!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's it!  No man lives who can call a Firefly an upstart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (As he offers the card) Touche.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Coldly) I shall report this indignity the my President. (To Mrs. Teasdale - polite but firm) Mrs. Teasdale,  I feel this regrettable occurrence will plunge our countries into war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TEASDALE (Half crying) This is terrible!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uncle, you can't do this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Politely) My dear niece -- I must ask you not to interfere.  War is not a woman's problem.

dialogue.raw_text: (Rising angrily) It is every woman's problem.  Who supplies the sons? -- the brothers? -- the husbands?  Who...

Chico has a red band across his shirt-front on which is embossed "Secretary of War" in gold letters.  An usher enters box with two people in the background.

direction.raw_text: They both step out of box, onto stage and stroll casually across as singing is going on.  Part of the way across, Harpo and Chico react to the singing of a very high note -- it's practically in Harpo's ear.  He stops -- makes a terrible face -- takes out ear-muffs, puts them on his ears and he and Chico continue toward the box -- CUT TO other box -- the one that Chico and Harpo are headed for.  Mrs. Teasdale and guests are being ushered in... Chico and Harpo come into scene, arriving at box.  Chico steps into box from stage.  Harpo is about to follow when he spies a pretty girl in box above.  He starts climbing up the proscenium arch to upper box -- the girl sees him, screams and dashes out of box.  Harpo completes climb into box -- at this point the singing has just finished and applause breaks out. Harpo acknowledges the applause as if it was in appreciation of his climb -- after a few quick bows he starts out of the box after the girl.  As he is running out of box into the foyer he bumps into Ambassador Trentino.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harpo takes out a pencil with heavy lead and writes the address on the white and purple-edged silk band which is across Trentino's shirt bosom.  Then he pushes Trentino's coat aside and from under his vest pulls the ribbon in the manner of a ticker tape -- tears it off -- and starts back to box.

Harpo, astonished, looks down on the victim who, minus the toupe, now displays a shiny bald pate. Harpo takes out his fountain pen and releases gadget. The ink pours down on the bald spot of the man below and spreads into the form of a toupe parted in the middle.  CUT BACK to Harpo - he places the toupe on the bare back side of a figure of Cupid carved on the arch.  He is now suddenly attracted by something on the stage -- it is a pool with a practical fountain in its center.  Harpo digs into a decorative flower box set in a groove in the proscenium arch. He brings out a real live worm and baits his hook -- stands up and casts... the line swishes through the air and the hook lands in the pool on the stage.  The line instantly tightens and a large carp fish is yanked out of the pool... as the line is drawn in the fish nearly hits Mrs. Teasdale. She covers her face with her hands.  Chico takes advantage of her action, grabs the line, removes the fish, and puts hook on handle of purse...  then signals Harpo with a whistle and in the manner of a construction foreman, motions to him to start "hoisting".  The line becomes taut and the purse is yanked out of view.  Mrs. Teasdale uncovers her face and discovers that the purse is missing.

direction.raw_text: to a Moving Insert - Harpo bringing the horse to a stop in front of a farm house.  He blows a blast on a regular army bugle... immediately a few old men rush out of the house in their nightgowns, carrying guns, and into the scene from all directions rush other men, answering the call, similarly attired.  Harpo starts his horse and we DISSOLVE to him pulling up to another farm house. This house has a single door on the extreme end of it and a very large French window covering almost the rest of the house.  Harpo stops and sounds the bugle call.  This time there is no answer to his call.  He waits a second, then turns his horse in the direction of the house and rides through the single door.  After a short pause, the doors of the French window fly open and the horse runs out pulling a double bed which is on wheels.  Harpo is standing at the foot of the bed, braced against the bedpost, holding the reins.  There is an old couple, man and woman, fast asleep in the bed - (This couple might be the blase gentleman and young wife used by Peter Arno in his cartoons.)  After riding a few feet Harpo leaps from the bed onto the horse's back and rides off leaving the bed and its occupants on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to Harpo pulling up to another farm house. He stops, sounds his bugle.  A very pretty young girl, in her night clothes pokes her head out of the second story window.  Harpo takes a good look at her, leaps off his horse and dashes into the house.  A moment later he comes out of the house with a feed bag and puts it on the horse's head.... then he dashes back into the house again.  Almost instantly he comes tearing out of the house, followed by an old geezer in his nightgown, who is chasing him, with rifle in hand... He fires a few shots -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through the shooting of previous scene to STOCK SHOT of artillery fire on battle field - a profile SHOT with all the activity of an actual battle, but without an indication of falling men.  DISSOLVE from this to interior of Groucho's headquarters behind the front - a wooden shack. The sound of a distant booming of guns is heard over this scene.  On the wall is a large war map with colored thumb tacks indicating the positions of Groucho's men and the enemy. Groucho, in the uniform of a Confederate General, (a Robert E. Lee make-up), is studying the war map with a few of his Generals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door flies open and Bob, in a snappy uniform, enters excitedly and breathlessly.  He faces Groucho with a quick salute and a click of the heels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho snatches the dispatch from Bob's hand, tears it open -- reads it quickly -- claps his hand to his brow and staggers. The generals crowd about him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whining of an approaching shell is heard and a shell about three feet long comes sailing through the open window, speeds through the room and tears through the opposite wall, leaving a clean-cut hole.  Groucho rushes to window and closes it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Looking at a tack in a distant sector) Either there's a fly in the room or we've got a soldier in Africa.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Taking a dispatch from under his belt) A dispatch from the front, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Solicitously) Bad news, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bad news -- its disastrous!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Simultaneously) What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Reading from dispatch) Private Moscowitz quits! (Groucho rushes to radio operator)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Clear all wires... (The operator works key)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The enemy has taken Hill 25, throwing twelve Hill-billies out of work... Our front is exposed to the enemy -- we'll have to bring up the rear... (Turning away, then turning back to Generals and continuing) P.S.  Have misplaced flag of truce... look in upper lefthand drawer of my bureau...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of No Man's Land, with shells exploding in all directions.  We see a head slowly appearing over the edge of shell-hole, looking through spy-glasses.  It is Harpo...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Inside of shell hole... Harpo registers that he has seen something of startling interest.  He drops the glasses, scrambles out of shell-hole and runs out of scene.  He rushes to his waiting motorcycle (without the side-car). The staff with the flag flying from it is attached to the handle-bars.  He leaps onto the motorcycle seat and starts off. CUT TO: A war nurse, attracted by the roar of the motorcycle. She looks back, sees Harpo approaching and breaks into a run. As he closes in on her, she jumps into a trench to escape him.  Harpo rides on a little further to the entrance of the trench and turns in, to continue his pursuit.  A TRUCKING SHOT shows only the flag and staff, tearing along above the surface, with the accompanying roar of the motorcycle which is hidden from view.  As it speeds along, soldiers are leaping up out of the trenches on every side to avoid being run down. This continues doing a zig-zag with abrupt turns... CUT BACK TO: Groucho's headquarters.  Groucho is discovered there alone, stropping his sword on a razor strap attached to his desk. Chico enters... goes to time-clock on wall, puts his workman's card in it and punches it.  Groucho, attracted by the bell of the time-clock, stops stropping and walks over to Chico, with sword in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho sits down at desk and Chico pulls up another chair and sits at opposite side of desk facing Groucho
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At this point, an unusually large shell comes crashing from above, imbedding itself, point down, in the floor without exploding.  Groucho and Chico rush over to look at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho opens door and yells to some one outside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harpo enters, bent forward, tugging at a rope which tightens over his shoulder, in the manner of a Volga Boatman... at the end of the rope is a cannon, on two wheels
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harpo pours a great quantity of powder into the cannon, then to make sure he has enough, he lights a match and looks into the hole.  Groucho takes the lighted match from Harpo.  He lights his own cigar, hands the match back to Harpo.  Harpo pours in a little more powder, makes sure he has enough, then proceeds to ram the powder in the barrel with his horn. He rises and moves to wall toward which the cannon is pointed. He draws a target on the wall with a piece of chalk -- goes back to cannon.  He picks up the firing string, and faces the target toward which the cannon is pointing.  Chico puts his fingers into his ears.  Groucho picks up a pencil from desk - taps it on desk - then raises both hands, in the manner of an orchestra leader.  He holds this pose for a second - and on the down beat, Harpo jerks the string and there is a terrific explosion.  The cannon fires out the back end instead of the front and blows a hole through the back wall.  The two stare off in the direction of the hole.  Groucho turns to Chico.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harpo opens the door and discloses a dozen or more snarling wolves at the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Late again, eh?  You haven't been on time once since this war started... (Puts sword in sheath) Get out there and fight... (Pointing commandingly in direction of battle field)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Surprised) Why not?  You're the Secretary of War, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, but I'm not working for you any more.  I'm on the other side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Like a surprised child) Is that so?  I used to think you were two-faced - but you can't be - or you wouldn't be wearing that one. Now - let's talk this thing over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Blowing out a puff of smoke) Now -- how many men you got in your army?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we gotta one hundred thousand men.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not fair -- we've only got fifty thousand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all right.  We let you have twenty-five thousand men -- and we both start even.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Enthusiastically) That's the spirit -- fifty-fifty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Seventy-five -- seventy-five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we'll let that one go.  Now -- how many battalions you got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We gotta two battalions and one Frenchman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish you were still working for me, so I could ask you to resign. How're ya fixed for cavalry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've gotta five thousand men but no horses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's funny, we've got five thousand horses but no men.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all right -- our men can ride your horses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not a bad idea.  If our horses get tired they can ride your men for a change. (Chico nods agreeingly) Now, I don't mind letting you have our horses, but you must promise to put them through their maneuvers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, sure.  We have horse maneuvers every morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Looking at shell) Acme Ammunition Company, eh?  How do you expect to win the war with shells that don't go off?  Now, if you were buying your stuff from me, you wouldn't have that trouble.  Eureka Ammunition is guaranteed to explode -- or your money back.  Let me show you some samples.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bring in No. 47, line 8.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Pointing to gun) That's our latest number...  our sixteen-inch Horowitz gun. (To Harpo) Load it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With a gun like that you can kill some of your own men.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's-a pretty good.  I'll take a dozen of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anything else? (Writing order on pad)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Mentally figuring) Yes, one gross of bullets, two dozen hand-grenades, three kegs of powder -- and throw in some matches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Writing) Fine.  We'll throw in the matches before we make the delivery.  By the way, how're you fixed for spys?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine.  We gotta him. (He indicates Harpo)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So! -- He's on your side, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, with you two fellows on the other side, this country should have no trouble keeping the wolf from the door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - INTERIOR enemy headquarters.   The booming of distant guns comes over the scene.  Trentino is there with a Sylvanian general.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chico enters. Trentino rushes over to him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Interior of Groucho's headquarters.  Groucho is on his feet addressing five or six generals, who are seated.  Zeppo is at the desk writing the minutes of the meeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bursting of a shell is heard right outside of shack. Groucho rushes to the window, opens it, fires a shot from his revolver through the window, hurriedly shuts it, then rushes back to Generals
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bursting of another shell is heard right outside of shack. Groucho rushes to the window, opens it, turns his back to window, takes out a pocket mirror, holds it up in front of him and shoots over his shoulder out of window, taking his aim from the reflection in the mirror, like a trick marksman. As Groucho walks away from window, he hears another explosion outside.  He rushes back to the window, takes a package of small firecrackers out of his pocket, detaches one of the firecrackers, lights it from his cigar and throws it out of the window.  A very small explosion is heard.  Groucho hurriedly shuts the window and rushes back to the generals, as we - CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Something must be done immediately. The soldiers are getting discouraged.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's only one thing to do... we must capture Firefly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But how?  It's a very dangerous undertaking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Standing near widow) Ask for volunteers.  Some one must make the sacrifice -- someone -- (Stops to gaze out of window attracted by off scene roar of motor) Here comes Chicolini.  Maybe he'll do it. (Walks away from window) Unless we can make Firefly our prisoner, we're lost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chicolini, you've come just in time. We need a man who's fearless, brave. A man who's willing to die, if necessary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right -- I'll go out and find one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Firefly must be captured at any cost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's easy, I'll get him for you wholesale.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It must be done right away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do it right away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got a date with a General's wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't that a little dangerous?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To General) Not unless you find it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boys, I hate to do this, but if you generals want this war to continue you'll have to take a cut --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can't afford to pay the money we've been paying. Now I don't want to lay anybody off.  My motto in this war is: - "Live and let live".
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - A LONG SHOT of a dirigible (miniature) -- then we go to a CLOSE UP of the dirigible.  On the bag, in large letters, is printed -- SYLVANIA G-62 The CAMERA PANS DOWN to the cabin of the dirigible. Chico and Harpo are standing at the open door looking down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harpo reaches back into the cabin, picks up an enormous hook and throws it out.  The rope that is attached to the hook starts playing out rapidly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look!  That's-a Firefly's headquarters. (Pointing down) We catch him right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: miniature of dirigible and rope dangling from it... Then CUT TO - SHOT of rope and hook as it approaches Groucho's headquarters.  It hooks onto the roof of the shack and raises it off the ground.  CUT TO -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - miniature of dirigible carrying the shack through the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - inside of headquarters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (To generals) Gentlemen, the overhead is killing us.  Everything is going up.  If we don't watch ourselves, we'll come down with a crash.  Now -- all those in favor of taking a cut say "aye"...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Protesting) But Your Excellency!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carried unanimously.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - SHOT of dirigible carrying the shack. The shack just clears a steeple by a few inches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INSIDE of headquarters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The general, without saluting, exits out of door and closes door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The second general exits out of door without saluting, closing door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The remaining generals jump to their feet, stand at attention and salute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of the generals exit through to door; the last one closing door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho goes to door, pulls it open, starts out -- CUT TO - EXTERIOR OF SHACK (against sky backing). Groucho is seen in the open doorway.  He comes out and walks down the steps (there are three steps attached to entrance of door, with railing on each side.  Groucho is about to step off into space.  He grabs the railing and hangs by his hands.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeppo rushes to door and pulls him up by the hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now go right out there and fight. (To one general) You go out there and relieve General Beauregard, and while you're at it, see what General Motors is doing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To another general) Call him back -- he didn't salute me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Father, he didn't salute you either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Angrily) Attention!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go out there -- all of you -- and bring those generals back -- dead or alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't those generals come back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll call them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind, I'll go after them myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Junior!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - Inside as Zeppo finishes pulling Groucho in.  Groucho scrambles to his feet, rushes to window, leans out of window backwards and looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of dirigible as seen by Groucho.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: inside of shack as Groucho pulls in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeppo runs for rifle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeppo returns and hands rifle to Groucho.  Groucho leans out of the window backwards and shoots up into the air...  CUT TO - dirigible (miniature) as the bag explodes.  The smoke fills the screen.  As the smoke clears away we see Groucho and Zeppo descending side by side in two parachutes against sky background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeppo takes out pad and pencil
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groucho and Zeppo descend out of scene, as Harpo and Chico come into scene from above, both suspended from the ropes of their parachutes... They are in a sitting position, with a board across their knees, playing cards...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - to a group of notables standing around a large table.  Among them are Mrs. Teasdale and Zeppo.  Groucho is the guest of honor, very gaily attired for the occasion. As we FADE INTO this scene, they are singing -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then follows a musical interlude during which Groucho says: -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all sit
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get my rifle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll get rid of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Zeppo) Take a letter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To whom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To whom it may concern...  Dear Gloria:  The air has done me a world of good.  I am five thousand feet above sea level speeding home to you.  Can you arrange to meet me at twenty-five hundred feet?  -- which is only asking you to meet me half way.  Don't be surprised if I drop in on you any minute... Your fun- loving Dictator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: FADE OUT END OF SEQUENCE "J" SEQUENCE "K" FADE IN

dialogue.raw_text: (Singing) Hail, hail, Freedonia...  Land of the brave and free!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dad is much too great for his position without a question.  I'd like to offer this with your permission as a suggestion: I really think he should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We really think he should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I really think he should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And wear a crown and everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I really think he should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From what I have been gathering, I think they think I should be king: I think they think I should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And wear a crown and everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And everything.  He should be king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Speaking to audience) You know I think they think I should be king. (Then turning to the guests - singing) Although it would please me to govern the throng, suppose I were king and then everything went wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TEASDALE The king can do no wrong!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The king can do no wrong!  The king can do no wrong!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course you're All aware a king must have an heir some one to pass the family name along will some one tell me where I'd ever get an heir if a king can do no wrong
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Standing up) The king can do no wrong! (They all sit down)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose a pretty dame Into my castle came - And let us say that I was going strong.  She might be stuck on me, but what good would it be, if the king can do no wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Standing up) The king can do to wrong! (Sitting down)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: King Solomon was game he gave each Girl his name to number them would make a list that long I'll bet his thousand wives led miserable lives if the king can do no wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Remaining seated) We really think he should be king and wear a crown and everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They think I should - They think I should - They think I should - They think I should be king. (APPLAUSE) Mrs. Teasdale rises.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TEASDALE My dear friends, in time of peace we should forgive those who fought against us, and so, I have invited our former enemies. (Applause)
dialogue.name: dialogue
